pullRequest.body:
add clique number, maximal and maximum cliques, and theorems about the relationship between clique number and the cardinality of cliques.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [2c256da680](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18446/commits/2c256da68089b01f5ea2daa84c9ffb79d59ad86d)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Clique | 548 | 556 | +8 (+1.46%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Triangle.Counting` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Turan`|6|
| `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Triangle.Basic` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Triangle.Tripartite`|7|
| `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Clique`|8|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsClique.card_le_cliqueNum`
`+ IsMaximumClique`
`+ IsMaximumClique.isMaximalClique`
`+ cliqueNum`
`+ exists_isNClique_cliqueNum`
`+ isMaximalClique_iff`
`+ isMaximumClique_iff`
`+ maximumClique_card_eq_cliqueNum`
`+ maximumClique_exists`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

@YaelDillies @kmill We are now defining `IsMaximumClique` and `IsMaximalClique` as structures, following `IsNClique`. Two things were unclear to me: why / when is the `I` at the beginning capitalized? Is it upper case for structures and lower case for lemmas? And why do we go for `(s : Finset α) (smc : G.IsMaximumClique s)` rather than `(s : G.MaximumClique)`, i.e., why don't we redefine the structures to have the set as an attribute rather than an argument?

Besides that, is there anything this PR is missing in terms of fundamental statements that you can think of?

> I have strain injuries to both wrists, hence must not type much. Please apologise the poor spelling, vague indications and general conciseness.

Thanks for the review and get better!

> why / when is the `I` at the beginning capitalized? Is it upper case for structures and lower case for lemmas?

Yes, almost. The precise rule is that Sort-valued things (like structures and predicates) are UpperCamelCase, while the rest is lower case (eitherlowerCamelCase or snnake_case).

> And why do we go for `(s : Finset α) (smc : G.IsMaximumClique s)` rather than `(s : G.MaximumClique)`, i.e., why don't we redefine the structures to have the set as an attribute rather than an argument?

Do you ever need to consider the collection of all maximum cliques and make it into a group or a lattice or a topological space,...? If not, you shoould keep things esparate
This is looking in pretty good shape!
I have strain injuries to both wrists, hence must not type much. Please apologise the poor spelling, vague indications and general conciseness.
This is looking in pretty good shape!

```suggestion
```
only one ewline

```suggestion
lemma IsClique.card_le_cliqueNum (t : Finset α) (tc : G.IsClique t) : #t ≤ G.cliqueNum :=
```
make t implicit

```suggestion
lemma exists_isNClique_cliqueNum : ∃ s, G.IsNClique G.cliqueNum s :=
```
What is the use case of these predicates?
You mean why define maximal cliques? Seemed sensible to include it when defining maximum cliques, but I don't think we need it for our particular application right now (unless @ooovi disagrees).
I mean both maximal and maximum cliques

Right now @ooovi was working on the AM-GM proof of Mantel which needs this notion. We have also in the past needed the clique number when doing some auxiliary stuff for the hypercube / sensitivity conjecture and I want to clean that up as well.

Actually both of these need the independence number (which requires a notion of independence set in the first place), for which we are preparing another PR that's intended to build on this.

> Right now @ooovi was working on the AM-GM proof of Mantel which needs this notion. We have also in the past needed the clique number when doing some auxiliary stuff for the hypercube / sensitivity conjecture and I want to clean that up as well.

How much do you need it? Is it like one lemma or two, or do you a full API about them

For my specific proof, I need the dual of `lemma maximumClique_card_eq_cliqueNum (s : Finset α) (sm : G.IsMaximumClique s) : #s = G.cliqueNum` and `lemma maximumClique_exists : ∃ (s : Finset α), G.IsMaximumClique s`, which are the corresponding statements about maximum independent sets and the coclique number. The dualization is in a seperate PR, #18608.
can you make private ?

```suggestion
  (isClique : G.IsClique s)
```
Should it then not also be named `isClique` in `structure IsNClique`?
Yes it should!
Hope it's fine if I add that change to this PR
Your Ctrl + F was too eager ;)
This looks like it could be written as `Maximal G.IsClique s` instead
Sweet! Should we keep it as an abbrev, or just use `Maximal G.IsClique s` everywhere? I did the former, for now.
I think just using `Maximal` is the cleaner way of doing it.

```suggestion
/-- The maximal number of vertices in a clique of a graph `G`. -/
```
Let's move this block so it's directly under the definition of `cliqueNum` - it shouldn't be in the CliqueFinset section.
Let's also move this block so it's directly after `maximal_of_maximum`.

```suggestion
lemma IsMaximumClique.isMaximalClique (s : Finset α) (M : G.IsMaximumClique s) : G.IsMaximalClique s :=
```
(provided I haven't got something wrong), this will mean you can write `M.isMaximalClique` in applications

```suggestion
      have hlt : #s < #t := card_lt_card (hsub.ssubset_of_ne hc.symm)
```
I think this should work!

pullRequest.title: feat(Combinatorics/SimpleGraph/Clique): add clique number
